Comments_List: I learned to analyze corruption in different countries as an economic, political, and cultural problem. I also learned how to write a report on economic analysis.
The class did an amazing job of incorporating topics of corruption, bribery and more to real world examples which helped to better understand the class and be prepared for the exam.
Strengths: Very interesting material, interdisciplinary approach.
Yes, this course allows you to analyze problems regarding corruption in different countries, and it helps understand the problem in an interdisciplinary way.
YES. This is a great summer ECON elective that isn't stressful but helps you learn so much about the broad topic of corruption.
